com.std.model.appointment

Class RefAppointment

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.std.model.appointment.RefAppointment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RefAppointment
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.io.Serializable
    A RefAppointment is an instantiated form of an Appointment. It stores the start date, and the parent AppointmentTemplate from which it will draw data such as the appointment's description, title, etc. This was done so that recurring appointments could be implemented. To make a full appointment, one can create a template, and instantiate it by making a RefAppointment that references the template and contains a start date for binding it to the calendar.

    Usage:
    CalendarModel model = new CalendarModel();

    // creates a new template
    AppointmentTemplate template = new AppointmentTemplate("title", "", "n/a", 0);

    // adds it to the calendar model
    model.getAppointmentTemplateSet().add(template);

    // creates a new reference to the template
    RefAppointment reference = new RefAppointment(template, new Date());

    // adds the reference to the calendar model
    model.getAppointmentSet().add(reference);
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
